授業目的: This course examines recent cases of conflict between society and religion in liberal democracies around the world.
到達目標: By taking this course students will gain a general understanding of important ongoing debates on the relationship between religion and society in liberal democracies around the world.

学生による授業評価の方法Course Evaluation by Student: Each course is positioned within the curriculum in accordance with the diploma policy and curriculum policy established by each undergraduate/graduate school. By proceeding with the study of this course with an awareness of the DP and CP, the following abilities expected by each undergraduate/graduate school will be developed.Asian Studies:1. Understanding and analytical skills regarding international issues: the ability to understand and analyze various regions of the world from different perspectives in the humanities and social sciences.2. Problem-solving skills: the ability to proactively identify problems and solve them based on appropriate methods.3. Intercultural understanding and multicultural coexistence: the ability to be sensitive to different cultures and to coexist with diverse cultures.
